repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
The correct utility code wasn't being included

Fixes issue #3065
Fixes issue #3064

comment_data.body: I'm not hugely keen on this, but couldn't find a better way of doing it
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2789,8 +2789,9 @@ def error_value(self):
         if self.return_type.is_pyobject:
             return "0"
         else:
-            #return None
-            return self.entry.type.exception_value
+            # protect against the corner-case where the user has specified a c++ translation function
+            if not isinstance(self.entry.type.exception_value, Node):

comment_data.body: This probably isn't _quite_ what the test is about, but it seemed the closest related place that it could be tested.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -35,4 +41,5 @@ cdef class TestClass:
 
 cdef class TestClass:
     cpdef test_func(self) except +handle_exception:
+        cppfunc()  # GH 3064 - cppfunc caused invalid code to be generated with +handle_exception

comment_data.body:
The repetition of this screams for a helper function, say, `needs_cpp_exception_conversion()`.
That also gives you enough space to spell out the cases in which `value` exists and is comparable, i.e. strings, I guess, instead of resorting to `getattr()`. Not sure if `value` can hold a byte string? (Which wouldn't compare equal to `"*"` in Py3.) Note that you could probably also use the `constant_value`.
I wonder if this should use a `NameNode` instead. Special cases are not special enough to break the rules.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2789,8 +2789,9 @@ def error_value(self):
         if self.return_type.is_pyobject:
             return "0"
         else:
-            #return None
-            return self.entry.type.exception_value
+            # protect against the corner-case where the user has specified a c++ translation function
+            if not isinstance(self.entry.type.exception_value, Node):

comment_data.body:
This might be enough – assuming we don't get exception value nodes with uninitialised `constant_result` values from … somewhere. But that would be a bug, I guess. :)
```suggestion
    if node.exception_value.constant_result == "*":
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -263,6 +263,20 @@ def translate_cpp_exception(code, pos, inside, py_result, exception_value, nogil
     code.putln(code.error_goto(pos))
     code.putln("}")
 
+def needs_cpp_exception_conversion(node):
+    # This is only called after confirming that node.exception_check == "+"
+    if node.exception_value is None:
+        return True
+    # exception_value can be a NameNode
+    # (in which case it's used as a handler function and no conversion is needed)
+    if node.exception_value.is_name:
+        return False
+    # or a CharNode with a value of "*"
+    if isinstance(node.exception_value, CharNode) and node.exception_value.value == "*":

comment_data.body:
Is this actually needed? According to your comments, if it's a function name, then it's a `NameNode` already, right?
(Note that your change leaves the method without return value in that case).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2789,8 +2789,9 @@ def error_value(self):
         if self.return_type.is_pyobject:
             return "0"
         else:
-            #return None
-            return self.entry.type.exception_value
+            # protect against the corner-case where the user has specified a c++ translation function
+            if not isinstance(self.entry.type.exception_value, Node):

comment_data.body:
I changed the naming convention here.
```suggestion
# ticket: 3065
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,32 @@
+# mode: run
+# tag: cpp, werror
+# ticket: gh3065

comment_data.body: `constant_result` isn't calculated because of `SkipDeclarations` in `ConstantFolding`. It ends up being under several layers of declarations, so I'll just revert this change rather than try to get `constant_result` calculated.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -263,6 +263,20 @@ def translate_cpp_exception(code, pos, inside, py_result, exception_value, nogil
     code.putln(code.error_goto(pos))
     code.putln("}")
 
+def needs_cpp_exception_conversion(node):
+    # This is only called after confirming that node.exception_check == "+"
+    if node.exception_value is None:
+        return True
+    # exception_value can be a NameNode
+    # (in which case it's used as a handler function and no conversion is needed)
+    if node.exception_value.is_name:
+        return False
+    # or a CharNode with a value of "*"
+    if isinstance(node.exception_value, CharNode) and node.exception_value.value == "*":

comment_data.body: I also raised the visibility on this warning because it seems like a pretty common mistake to make, and doesn't do what people expect.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2504,8 +2504,15 @@ def analyse_declarations(self, env):
                   "Function with optional arguments may not be declared public or api")
 
         if typ.exception_check == '+' and self.visibility != 'extern':
-            warning(self.cfunc_declarator.pos,
+            if typ.exception_value and typ.exception_value.is_name:
+                # it really is impossible to reason about what the user wants to happens
+                # if they've specified a C++ exception translation function. Therefore,
+                # raise an error.
+                error(self.cfunc_declarator.pos,
                     "Only extern functions can throw C++ exceptions.")
+            else:
+                warning(self.cfunc_declarator.pos,
+                    "Only extern functions can throw C++ exceptions.", 2)

comment_data.body: This file was removed as part of the "make it an error rather than try to make sense of confusing instructions" change - I don't think there's a way to do the test now

If this is worth a comment, it seems worth an assertion.
```suggestion
    assert node.exception_check == "+"
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -263,6 +263,20 @@ def translate_cpp_exception(code, pos, inside, py_result, exception_value, nogil
     code.putln(code.error_goto(pos))
     code.putln("}")
 
+def needs_cpp_exception_conversion(node):
+    # This is only called after confirming that node.exception_check == "+"

commit.message:
Fix except+* exception handling

Fixes issue #3065
Fixes issue #3066

Apply suggestions from code review

Co-authored-by: scoder <stefan_ml@behnel.de>
